meanings.definition: The act or fact of going before; precedence
meanings.sent1: In the line, the antecedence of the first person was clear.
meanings.sent2: The antecedence of the teacher's arrival was the signal for the students to quiet down.
meanings.sent3: The antecedence of the chicken crossing the road was to get to the other side.
meanings.sent4: The antecedence of the sun rising every morning is the earth's rotation.
meanings.sent5: The antecedence of the alarm clock ringing wakes me up every day.

meanings.definition: A preceding event, condition, or cause
meanings.sent1: The antecedence of the storm was the dark clouds gathering in the sky.
meanings.sent2: Before the power outage, the antecedence was a strong gust of wind.
meanings.sent3: The antecedence of the cat knocking over the vase was its curiosity.
meanings.sent4: The antecedence of the tree falling in the forest was the strong wind that blew it down.
meanings.sent5: The antecedence of the car breaking down was the engine overheating.
